p.codeblock: public abstract int CreateDataStream(ref int streamId, bool reliable, bool ordered);

section.p: You can call this method to create a data stream and improve the reliability and ordering of data transmission.
section.note: If you need a more comprehensive low-latency, high-concurrency, and scalable real-time messaging and state synchronization solution, we recommend using [Real-time Messaging](https://doc.shengwang.cn/doc/rtm2/unity/landing-page). During the lifecycle of , each user can create up to 5 data streams. Data streams are destroyed when leaving the channel and must be recreated if needed.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method can be called before or after joining the channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After setting reliable to , if the receiver does not receive the data sent by the sender within 5 seconds, the callback is triggered with the corresponding error information.

plentry.pd: An output parameter. ID of the created data stream.

pd.note: Make sure to set both reliable and ordered to or both to .
pd.ph: Whether to ensure data reliability, i.e., whether the receiver must receive the data within 5 seconds after it is sent:

ul.li: : The receiver will receive the data within 5 seconds, otherwise the callback is triggered with the corresponding error information.
: The receiver is not guaranteed to receive the data, and no error is reported even if the data is lost.

plentry.pd:
Whether to ensure data ordering, i.e., whether the receiver must receive data in the order sent:
: The receiver receives data packets in the order sent by the sender.
: The receiver is not guaranteed to receive data packets in the order sent by the sender.

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
